div.span: Pride Prep challenges students to use knowledge and skills in a way that prepares them for real life.

figure.class: sqs-block-image-figure image-block-outer-wrapper image-block-v2 design-layout-overlap combination-animation-reveal individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none image-position-left

img.alt: Coronavirus information - Our top priority is the health and safety of our students, staff and community.

div.p: Coronavirus information
Our top priority is the health and safety of our students, staff and community.
We hope you’re staying safe and healthy during this challenging time. We miss you all so much.

Following the direction of Governor Jay Inslee’s order on April 6, 2020, the PRIDE and Innovation school buildings will continue to be closed for the remainder of this school year, to support the safety of our families and our broader community during the COVID-19 pandemic. While our building will be closed, our team is continuing to work hard to support you and our students. Our work continues.

In anticipation of extended closure, our team has been working around-the-clock to ensure that we are fully prepared to support our students remotely throughout the spring. Our commitment to advancing equity and eliminating the opportunity gap across our state has never been so focused.

We know that school closures as extended as this have significant impacts on families and cause ripples throughout our community, so this is something that we take very seriously. We will continue our contingency plans for providing meals and will ramp up our learning supports at home starting April 13, 2020.

After spring break, you will receive communication from the team on Phase 2 of our distance learning model that will include further support in new content acquisition, review of course work that was challenging for individual students, and project work.

While our building may be closed, our students still deserve access to high quality learning. We take comfort in the strength and creativity of our team and the stability of our family partnerships to push our community forward during this challenging time. It's truly a team effort to keep our community strong and I don’t think we’ve ever been stronger together than we are right now. Thank you for your courage and resilience and for partnering with us to ensure every student at PRIDE Schools is fully supported.
With gratitude and deep respect,

Dr. Brenda R. McDonald
Superintendent
For more school closure information, visit the Washington Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction website ›

If you have not yet signed up for student meals and would like to, please CLICK HERE and fill out the form. Starting April 13th, all meals will be delivery only. Staff will be delivering after 2pm each Monday until school resumes for this school year.
Thank you and we hope you and your families are staying healthy and safe!

We are continuing to monitor the evolving COVID-19 situation, and are committed to keeping you updated on our response to this public health crisis. We are coordinating closely with the Spokane Regional Health District and are following their guidance regarding school closures.

Please check PRIDE Schools District website (www.prideschools.org) and our social media feeds for any updates. We plan to send updates as needed to families through our School Messenger notification system, so please be sure your contact information is current.

div.h2: Interested in learning more about our school?
div.p: Talk to our enrollment specialist today! We’ll give you a tour, answer questions, and give you the opportunity to talk with current students. Contact Marcia by phone at 509.309.7680 or by email at marcia@prideschools.org

div.div: Since August 2019, Pride Prep has been authorized by the International Baccalaureate (IB) Organization to offer the Middle Years Programme for grades 6 through 8. We are an IB world school that is part of a global network of schools who are committed to providing a high-quality, challenging, international education.

div.p: Each year we have a public lottery to select our new incoming 6th grade class. Students not chosen in the lottery are put onto a waitlist. Most students move up to the next grade, however some seats do become available. As such, we have a waitlist for each grade in our middle school.

Pride Schools does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained guide dog or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. the following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:
Tylor Labelle, Title IX Coordinator, tylor@prideschools.org | Erik Hildahl, Section 504/ADA Coordinator for PRIDE Prep Middle School, erik@prideschools.org | Andre Dove, Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator, andre@prideschools.org | District Address: 811 E.
